title.narrative: 3.3. Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) EMER. PREPAREDNESS RESPONSE

description.narrative: 3.3 Emergency affected people access lifesaving Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) interventions within the first 96 hours to reduce morbidity and mortality., which contributes to Sanitation, Wash And Emergencies, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: More communities use sustained Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services and are empowered to stop harmful sanitation and hygiene behaviours.

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF INTERIOR LOCAL GOVERNMENT AND RECONCILIATION SOUTHWEST STATE OF SOMALIA

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 3.3 Emergency affected people access lifesaving WASH interventions within the first 96 hours to reduce morbidity and mortality.

description.narrative: UNICEF provided WASH support to more than 1.79 Million people (40% out of 4.5 Million people emergency affected people) to mitigate against the impact of drought that is affecting many parts of Somalia. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/07/2017

title.narrative: UNICEF-targeted population in humanitarian situations accessing sufficient quantity of water of appropriate quality for drinking, cooking and personal hygiene

target.value: 2017:60% (It is acknowledged that other WASH agencies will cover 40%)
